snippet: Delmon Young, formerly of the Detroit Tigers, accepted a plea deal on charges of aggravated harassment in New York, and was ordered to attend a half-day program at the Museum of Tolerance.
abstract: Former Detroit Tigers designated hitter Delmon Young, who was arrested on April 27 for screaming anti-Semitic epithets outside New York hotel, pleads guilty to aggravated harassment and is sentenced to 10 days of community service; is ordered to attend half-day program at the Museum of Tolerance, where he will learn about the horrors and heroes of the Holocaust.
lead_paragraph: Delmon Young, formerly of the Detroit Tigers, accepted a plea deal on charges of aggravated harassment in New York, and was ordered to attend a half-day program at the Museum of Tolerance.

headline.seo: Court Orders Delmon Young to Tour Museum of Tolerance
headline.main: Slugger’s Penalty Includes a Walk Through History
headline.print_headline: Slugger’s Penalty Includes a Walk Through History
